abstract: Occupy Wall Street encampment, now extending into its second month, coincides with busy Jewish holiday season, drawing criticism from politically conservative groups that movement is flashing signs of anti-Semitism; protesters counter, however, pointing out number of Jewish holiday celebrations that have taken place in Zuccotti Park encampment.
snippet: The Occupy Wall Street protests have increasingly been criticized for flashes of anti-Semitism. But the protests have also, on occasion, had a distinctly Jewish flavor.
lead_paragraph: The Occupy Wall Street protests have increasingly been criticized for flashes of anti-Semitism. But the protests have also, on occasion, had a distinctly Jewish flavor.

headline.main: Cries of Anti-Semitism, but Not at Zuccotti Park
headline.print_headline: Cries of Anti-Semitism, But Not at Zuccotti Park
headline.seo: Occupy Wall Street Criticized for Flashes of Anti-Semitism
